column4: Sarbull: Do you think it's overheating because you feel heat, or because you are using a heat monitor? Also, did this ever happen with Windows?
Sarbull: Because if you just feel it near the fan, that just means that the fan is working.
Sarbull: My laptop is always warm near the fan. But the rest of it is fine. It's just the fan doing its job.
Sarbull: Possibly in the BIOS.
Sarbull: Or take a look at this: http://superuser.com/questions/324210/ubuntu-11-04-disable-nvidia-graphics-card
Sarbull: Not your card, but the same question.
Sarbull: Maybe use one of those "turn it on" options.
Osmosis: Go to the dash, and search for "system monitor".
Osmosis: One of the tabs (I think the far left one) will tell you.
Osmosis: Don't know how to do it from CMD. But just hit your Windows key, or whatever you have, or just click the dash button, and search "system monitor".
package cache might show you which version of e.g. FF is installed
